nitpick; adapted to the Roman alphabet, not to the Latin language.
/* Related links */ Added related wikilinks

No need to specify "under Hitler" here. The axis countries include, for example, Japan, which did not assist in the Holocaust (probably busy with its own crimes against humanity then). Collaboration might be mentioned, using a proper description.

/* Aftermath and historiography */ Adding [[Holocaust research]] in the section "Cultural, political, and scholarly responses". "Criticism of Holocaust denial" seems to have been the only scholarly response in that section so far.

/* Miscellaneous */ A list of artists may be useful here, but a [[List of composers influenced by the Holocaust]] that does not explain anything about how they have been influenced seems to be unhelpful.
/* Miscellaneous */ No idea why these persons have been singled out here.
/* Miscellaneous */ No indication that this particular book would be exceptionally significant, given the large amount of literature on the Holocaust.
/* Miscellaneous */ Not significant in that context. Seems to be an addition motivated by POV.
